regulationsummary: Hong Kong AMLCFT regulations require financial institutions to collect detailed originator and recipient information for wire transfers of 8,000 or more, while a reduced set of data is acceptable for lowervalue transfers Institutions must provide missing information to beneficiary or intermediary institutions within three business days and take remedial action if data is incomplete or meaningless Enhanced due diligence EDD is mandated for highrisk situations, for transactions involving foreign institutions, and when recordkeeping or correspondent banking relationships raise concerns All institutions must maintain records for at least five years and establish procedures to identify politically exposed persons and handle noncompliant transfers The rules also cover virtual asset transfers, remittance transactions, and the due diligence required for establishing correspondent banking relationships

actionablerules.obligation: Collect and record the originators account number or unique reference, originators address, identification number or dateplace of birth, recipients name, and recipients account number or unique reference for every wire transfer of 8,000 or more
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All ordering institutions processing domestic or foreign wire transfers of 8,000 or more
risksignalstomonitor: Transfers above the threshold without complete originatorrecipient details
Large singleday volume of highvalue transfers
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Wire transfer instruction form with required fields
Customer identification documents ID card, passport, etc
Internal audit log confirming data capture
Approval from senior management for each highvalue transfer
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is required for any transfer where the originator or recipient is a politically exposed person, a known or suspected moneylaundering suspect, or a foreign entity with limited regulatory oversight

actionablerules.obligation: For wire transfers below 8,000, collect and record the originators account number or unique reference, originators address, recipients name, and recipients account number or unique reference
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All ordering institutions processing domestic or foreign wire transfers below 8,000
risksignalstomonitor: Frequent lowvalue transfers that aggregate to large amounts
Transfers to or from highrisk jurisdictions
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Wire transfer instruction form with required fields
Customer identification records
Transaction monitoring system flagging aggregation of lowvalue transfers
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  standard due diligence suffices unless other highrisk indicators are present

actionablerules.obligation: If a beneficiary or intermediary institution receives a wire transfer lacking any required information, it must obtain the missing data from the ordering institution within three business days and, if unavailable, either restrictterminate the relationship or implement reasonable AMLTFT mitigation measures
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All beneficiary and intermediary institutions receiving wire transfers
risksignalstomonitor: Requests for information that are denied or delayed
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written request for missing information
Record of response time and action taken
Documentation of any relationship restriction or mitigation steps
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is required if the missing information relates to a highrisk jurisdiction or a knownsuspected moneylaundering suspect

actionablerules.obligation: Apply enhanced due diligence for any customer or beneficial owner that is a politically exposed person, a known or suspected moneylaundering suspect, or a customer from a highrisk jurisdiction, including sourceofwealth verification and ongoing monitoring
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All customers, beneficial owners, and highrisk counterparties
risksignalstomonitor: Political exposure, public office, or close associates
requireddocumentsorcontrols: PEP declaration and verification documents
Sourceofwealth statements
Enhanced transaction monitoring rules
Periodic review reports
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is mandatory for all identified highrisk categories

actionablerules.obligation: Maintain original or copies of all documents and records related to each transaction and customer for at least five years, and keep customer files throughout the business relationship plus five years after termination
risksignalstomonitor: Failure to retain records beyond the statutory period
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Secure electronic database or microfilm storage
Retention schedule and audit trail
Periodic internal audits of recordkeeping compliance
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  this is a standard recordkeeping requirement

actionablerules.obligation: Before establishing a correspondent banking relationship with a foreign institution, collect sufficient information on the institutions business, reputation, supervision quality, and AMLTFT controls obtain senior management approval and document responsibilities for both parties
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All authorized institutions entering correspondent banking relationships
risksignalstomonitor: Lack of physical presence in the foreign jurisdiction
Poor regulatory supervision or weak AMLTFT controls
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Duediligence report on the foreign institution
Senior management approval documentation
Agreements outlining responsibilities and datasharing protocols
Ongoing monitoring plan for the relationship
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is required if the foreign institution is located in a highrisk jurisdiction or has inadequate AMLTFT controls
